intro: Ferula oopoda, commonly known as the Persian cow's milk plant, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of yellow-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are lance-shaped and aromatic, while its roots are thick and fibrous. Ferula oopoda is often found growing in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions.
